content: So everything seems to work just fine but my friend has the same app, but has a different feature. He can play the hands without betting. So he's able to play the hands so much faster and I don't know why I don't have that feature. He has a apple phone and mines an android, would that be the difference?
replyContent: There are a few minor features that haven't made it from our iOS app to our Android app quite yet. We intend to add these within the next few updates to the app. Thanks for your patience in the meantime.

content: Great app, but I have one recommendation. If the user could somehow choose specific deviations to focus on, that would be helpful in my opinion. Perhaps a new drill mode (Deviations only) could be added which only deals hands that deviate from basic strategy. If the user could also select which deviations are dealt in that drill, that would be terrific. For example, only H17 deviations 1-5, 1-10 etc. Other than that, the app is quick and efficient :)
Great game to learn how to card count!
This app is great, it'll freeze and force close every now and then but it still sharpens my skills.
The only complaint I have is that in addition to a the "hands without error" count I would like to have a percentage of correct hands maybe a total, or just your last 100 or 1000 hands.
replyContent: Hey Andy, Thanks for the feedback. I'll add your suggestion to the list of features to consider adding in future updates.

content: I can't seem to see one card when playing two hands. It's either too far left or too far right. I would also prefer to have a button that tells the dealer what I'm doing vs the hand signals! On Android Note 9
replyContent: Hey, Thanks for the feedback. We do have the option to use buttons instead of gestures to make playing decisions. It can be found in the in-game settings menu (the little 'gear' on the bottom right of the drill). Hope that helps!

content: Great app, definitely worth it if you are interested in his videos!
Great app, just imo a little strange that the option to surrender is sliding the finger forward but the stand is drawing a line, when in reality the surrender is drawing a line
replyContent: Hey Alex, Thanks for the feedback. For what it's worth, I believe the thinking behind the choice was that swiping most closely resembles waving off a hand, and you'll be doing that far more often than surrendering. But I definitely see what you are saying.

content: All this has is a bj simulation and strategy cards, you can get this for free anywhere. I really hope you add more to this app or you're going to have some very mad customers. There is nothing related to cards counting. After using the application for about a month, I'm changing my review. The app does have a lot of the features I initially thought were missing because it wasn't clear that the options existed. After using it for a while I did find what I was looking for in a sub-menu. So, to be clear, you can work on card counting and deviations in this app, which is what sets it apart from the others. If I had been able to simply see these options from the jump I would have given five stars.
replyContent: Hey Jeremy, Sorry for the trouble. Our app is a blackjack simulation that gives users feedback on if they are playing basic strategy correctly, keeping the running count correctly, converting to the true count correctly, and deviating correctly. Are there other features you'd like to see added? If so, email me: jonathan@blackjackapprenticeship.com

content: Completely sucks!!!!!
replyContent: Hey Jay, sorry to hear that. If you want you let us know what we could do to make the app more to your liking, email me at jonathan@blackjackapprenticeship.com

content: Great app overall only problem is you cannot see the deck of cards to do true count conversion (Edit: there were there just in a hidden, now available by default, thankyou BJA!
replyContent: Hey Robert, Sorry for the trouble. If you press the 'gear' icon on the bottom right of the drill this opens up the in-drill setting menu. In that menu, you'll find the option to enable 'Discard Tray Images'. That will display the discard tray so true count conversion is possible. Hope that helps!

content: needs a lot of work. You can't tell me to "hit" and "stand" at the same time then smack me on the hand when I select either. And also, where is the discard tray? How are we supposed to estimate the true count ? I know Colin Jones will make this better...
replyContent: Hey Chris, Sorry for the trouble you had with a 16 vs. a dealer 10. We've fixed this in our recent release. Thanks for your patience!

content: So far the app only has game simulation, no drills for practicing basic strategy or keeping the count on their own. Also sad not to see ES10 in the rules options. (I can't find it anywhere!) Hopefully there's more to come, but right now you can find similar with more features for cheaper.
replyContent: Our development team will definitely consider your opinion and make the game better. Please email us more specific suggestions at jonathan@blackjackapprenticeship.com.

content: Not worth 5 dollars for sure not bad though
replyContent: Hey, thanks for the feedback. Care to share what would make the app more valuable to you? If so, email me at jonathan@blackjackapprenticeship.com

content: Great for practice, still has minor bugs and I would love to see some betspred charts and bankroll growth charts
replyContent: Hey, Thanks for the feedback. We've fixed several bugs since the initial launch of the app. Feel free to try our most recent update and let us know what you think!

content: Yes, finally, after years of waiting, we have this on Android. It's a great app if you're a serious blackjack player. Allows you to practice counting and playing without carrying a deck of cards around and also provides the charts you need to play Perfect blackjack.

If you're serious about wanting to learn card counting, whether for a hobby or a legitimate source of income, absolutely nothing beats BJA. Great app, awesome community and an unbeatable website. No matter what your reason is to learn card counting, BJA will give you the tools to be successful. You just have to do the work.
Awesome app!!!! Attention to detail is amazing. By far best training app.
The best tool for blackjack players if you are serious or just want to have fun. This is the app you need
replyContent: Great to hear! Thanks for the feedback.

content: Best training I've found. Master this training and you'll have the skills!
Wow great app , really helps improve my game . So easy to use.

This app has is the best mobile training card counters have available. It is inclusive with a large variety option all with a unique and intuitive interface. For those wanting to train on the go or even just at home, this app cannot be recommended enough.

His bootcamps are legendary and created several 6-figure counters! Now he has developed software to help you learn the game and maybe one day you can get there as well! This will help you no matter what level you're at. From the beginner who needs to learn basic strategy to the pro on the road who needs to keep their skills sharp. Downloading this app is the first step to generating positive EV and kicking some casino butt!
Best card counting app on the market! I am STOKED it has made its way to the Google play store (I used to have to borrow my girlfriend's iPhone to use the iOS app). Couldn't be happier!!
Woo Woo, it's actually really for real here. Great job, can't wait to dig in.
